enHTML" are too harsh: most humans, as the LLMs, would perform worse if the tests are slightly made harder or if useless information is added.

X.T: La sagesse selon YouTube : plongée dans un océan de contenu généré par IA

ARTICLE.COMMENT: Some subjects (here Stoicism) on YouTube are submerged by AI-generated content with a very low quality level.

X.T: Is Artificial Superintelligence Imminent? with Tim Rocktäschel

ARTICLE.COMMENT:
TimRocktäschel explains how they are trying to get better results by having models prompting and evaluating themselves, and describes the experiments and results done in these two papers: "Promptbreeder: Self-Referential Self-Improvement Via Prompt Evolutionhttps://arxiv.org/abs/2309.16797
enHTML" and "Debating with More Persuasive LLMs Leads to More Truthful Answershttps://arxiv.org/abs/2402.06782
enHTML".

X.T: Tragedy of the (data) commons
X.ST: Ben chats with Shayne Longpre and Robert Mahari of the Data Provenance Initiative about what GenAI means for the data commons. They discuss the decline of public datasets, the complexities of fair use in AI training, the challenges researchers face in accessing data, potential applications for synthetic data, and the evolving legal landscape surrounding AI and copyright.

ARTICLE.COMMENT: The subtitle says it all.

X.T: Math Anxiety? and what it has to do with AI – 🔴at #HLF24 with Prof. Yael Tauman Kalai

ARTICLE.COMMENT: From the claim that mathematical fluency is often considered an indicator of intelligence, to the fact that using maths to evaluate a model is simple but misleading.

X.T: How Is AI Changing the Science of Prediction?
X.ST: With lots of data, a strong model and statistical thinking, scientists can make predictions about all sorts of complex phenomena. Today, this practice is evolving to harness the power of machine learning and massive datasets. In this episode, co-host Steven Strogatz speaks with statistician Emmanuel Candès about black boxes, uncertainty and the power of inductive reasoning.

ARTICLE.COMMENT: AI models can be used to generate data which is validated statistically.

X.T: A student of Geoff Hinton, Yann LeCun, and Jeff Dean explains where AI is headed
X.ST: Ben and Ryan are joined by Matt Zeiler, founder and CEO of Clarifai, an AI workflow orchestration platform. They talk about how the transformer architecture supplanted convolutional neural networks in AI applications, the infrastructure required for AI implementation, the implications of regulating AI, and the value of synthetic data.

ARTICLE.COMMENT: A classic interview of a classic AI company.

X.T: Google Cars versus Tesla (ft. Boi Faltings)

ARTICLE.COMMENT: Google is using classical AI to decide how to drive, Telsa is using deep learning to mimic human drivers, Telsa’s solution is much faster to implement but cannot go as far as Google’s one, since it cannot do much better than what humans are currently doing.

X.T: Why You Should Want Driverless Cars On Roads Now
